Barry says they walk on eggshells, waiting for Brandon’s next violent outburst and that every day he leaves the house worried that his wife may not make it to the end of the day. For protection, the couple says they’ve even installed locks on various doors throughout their home, providing Phyllis a "safe room" in which to hide. What is at the root of Brandon's anger? Dr. Phil spends some one-on-one time with the young man to determine what’s driving his behavior. And, find out what Phyllis recently found in Brandon’s room that shocked her to her core.

episodes.name: Killer Mom: The Sole Survivor and Remarry or Run?
Brutal Beauties: The Trouble with Tiffani
Deadly New Accusations: A Murder Mystery?
Broken Bones, Broken Hearts and Broken Engagements?
Dr. Phil Mystery: Was Morgan Murdered by Stalkers?
My Ex Is Accused of Murder
episodes.overview: Charlotte’s ex-boyfriend, Gary, has been charged with the first-degree murder of 20-year-old Heather, and Charlotte says she blames herself. She accuses Gary of victimizing her physically and sexually for years and claims she failed to tell the whole truth to prosecutors when Gary was charged with first-degree assault with a deadly weapon against her, thereby allowing him to serve minimal jail time. Now, hear from a lead investigator in Heather’s case — can Charlotte help prosecutors — and will she? Then, Charlotte’s former live-in nanny makes another allegation against Gary that she says happened when she was just a teen. What did Charlotte know? And, Charlotte’s husband, Race, says his wife is hung up on her abusive past and their marriage is suffering. Can Dr. Phil help save this union? If you are the victim of domestic violence, tune in to find out what you must do to protect yourself.

episodes.name: Young and Reckless/Ask Dr. Phil
episodes.overview: When Dr. Phil first met eye-rolling, defiant 16-year-old Sabby, she was too much for her mother, Courtney, to handle. After the show, Dr. Phil sent Sabby to Turn-About Ranch, a residential facility for troubled teens, where after 16 weeks, she was making progress — until Courtney cut short the teen’s treatment and took her home. Now, Courtney says Sabby is smoking marijuana, having sex and has dropped out of school — behavior that Courtney says has also rubbed off on Sabby’s 14-year-old sister. Courtney pleads for Dr. Phil’s help once again — is it too late to get this out-of-control teen back on the right track? Then, Lisa says her 15-year-old son, Brandon, is a “raging lunatic” who smokes marijuana and has assaulted her, his stepfather, Tom, and other children — and she fears he’ll end up dead or seriously hurting someone. Brandon admits that he loses control when he’s angry but says that he just wants his parents to butt out of his life.

episodes.name: Secrets, Betrayals and Shocking Revelations
episodes.overview: Jodi says her husband, Glenn, has been lying to her for years about his use of prescription painkillers. She says Glenn used to be an honest, hard-working husband and father, but now she claims he sneaks behind her back to see doctors and is only concerned about finding his next fix. Glenn says the pills are prescribed for a long-term back injury and that he’s not addicted. With their marriage crumbling around them, are Jodi and Glenn willing to work to save it? And, when Dr. Phil takes a closer look at Glenn’s prescription drug use, will the father of two reevaluate his level of dependency? And will he accept help? Then, Crystal says her husband was shot and killed by a man who he thought was a good friend. The gunman claims self-defense — but was it? Crystal says the man hasn’t been charged, and she wants justice. And, Christine says she kept her father’s crime a secret for more than 25 years, but she recently revealed the truth to police.

episodes.name: Affairs, Obsessions and Extreme Parenting
episodes.overview: Rachel admits that she spoiled her daughter, Isabella, and says she’s now a rude, violent, and out-of-control 15-year-old who abuses drugs and alcohol and may be destined for a life behind bars. She says Isabella gets into fights, steals, runs away and has overdosed at least three times. Isabella admits that she has a problem with anger, but blames her mother for her bad behavior. Hear why she says Rachel abandoned her when she needed her most. Can Dr. Phil and psychologist Dr. Charles Sophy get this mother-daughter relationship back on track? Then, Hallie says her sister, Crystal, is so obsessed with her ex-boyfriend that her endless attempts to win him back could cost her everything. She says Crystal has already lost her job, is about to lose her home, and has been neglecting her two young daughters. When Dr.

episodes.name: Violent Twins Return
episodes.overview: When Dan and Teresa first appeared on Dr. Phil, they sought help for their 16-year-old identical twins Drew and Dallas, who they said were destructive, dangerous and abusing drugs. The parents admitted they had lost control of their sons. Following the show, the couple agreed to send the boys to separate wilderness camps. Two months later, do Dan and Teresa still stand by their decision? And, watch the boys reunite for the first time since being sent away. Have they made a change for the better? Then, when Lane met with Dr. Phil, she was a single mom struggling with drug addiction. It’s been almost a year — how is she now? And, New York Times best-selling author of Running with Scissors Augusten Burroughs joins the show to share his journey toward sobriety, and the common triggers for relapse.

episodes.name: Trayvon's Parents, Zimmerman's Best Friend: The Verdict Reaction
episodes.overview: The shooting death of unarmed teenager Trayvon Martin sent shockwaves through the country last year and sparked huge debate over whether the gunman, George Zimmerman’s, life was truly in danger at the time. Recently, many were stunned when a jury of six women acquitted Zimmerman of second-degree murder and all other charges, and protests ignited across the country. Did the justice system fail? Or was justice served? Dr. Phil is joined by human rights activist Martin Luther King III, who weighs in on the verdict and what has become one of the biggest civil rights debates since the Rodney King incident. Then, criminal defense attorney Mark Eiglarsh and journalist and host of TV One’s new show News One Now Roland Martin join the discussion. Hear their insight into the not guilty verdict. Plus, what does the future hold for Zimmerman? Dr. Phil weighs in.

episodes.name: Skeptics Beware: The Psychic Intuitives Are Here
My Son Picked the Wrong Fiancée"
Peeping Tom Husband: Hidden Webcam and Secret Videos
Confronting the Girl Who Shot Me in the Face
Missing or Murdered: Where is 15-Year-Old Erica?
Missing or Murdered: Where is 15-Year-Old Erica? Part 2: The Polygraph
Trapped by My Cop Abuser: Why Won't Anyone Believe Me?
It’s Either Me or Your Deadbeat Son
It's Either Me or Your Deadbeat Son" Part 2: Meet Grandma
Secret Life of a Sex Addict
episodes.overview: Whether sex addiction is a real disorder or just an excuse for bad behaviour. Marcos and Yvette say they are unable to stop having affairs and Staci says she meets strangers for sex anytime and anywhere.

episodes.name: Tragic Beauty: The Exclusive Story of a Bachelorette's Suicide
episodes.overview: "The Bachelor" star Gia Allemand's mother discusses her recent suicide, and co-star Jake Pavelka gives an emotional tribute.

episodes.name: Love Scams: Courted by a Catfish?
episodes.overview: Dr. Phil sends a private investigator to check up on guests' fiances, whom they have never met in person; a woman flies to Nigeria to confront an online con artist; the man whose identity was stolen to lure former guest Dawn into a fake relationship.

episodes.name: Football Star Accused: Did He Do It?
episodes.overview: A teen football star accused of rape and his accuser speak out about how one alcohol-fueled night changed their lives in an instant; his parents insist that their son is innocent and that the girl just wants attention.

episodes.name: Football Star Accused: The Alleged Victim Speaks Out
episodes.overview: A 16-year-old girl says four classmates raped her while she was intoxicated; one of the accused and his parents react; Leah says her 17-year-old daughter committed suicide after being raped and bullied; Alexis says she was also raped as a teen.

episodes.name: Outrageous Monster-in-Law Khalood Is Back!
episodes.overview: Self-professed monster-in-law Khalood returns with shocking news; her daughter has a heart-to-heart with Dr. Phil.

episodes.name: Still Missing: Where Is 7-Year-Old Kyron?
episodes.overview: The parents of a missing child come together to tell Dr. Phil why they believe his stepmother may know more than she is admitting.

episodes.name: Dangerous Online Obsession (1)
episodes.overview: A mother learns the details of her 17-year-old daughter's online and offline activities.

episodes.name: Dangerous Online Obsession (2)
episodes.overview: The parents of a 15-year-old girl who appears to have been abducted and killed by a man she met on Facebook come forward to share their heartbreaking story.

episodes.name: The Bitter Battle Over Modern Family's Ariel Winter
episodes.overview: The mother of teen "Modern Family" star Ariel Winter, who lost custody of the girl amid accusations of physical and verbal abuse, tells her side of the story.

episodes.name: Nick Carter Tells All About Hitting Rock Bottom
episodes.overview: Nick Carter of the Backstreet Boys discusses his struggles with drugs and alcohol; a teen high-school dropout admits to abusing drugs, stealing her parents' car and dating a man nearly 10 years older.

episodes.name: Dropout Daughter: Confronting the Boyfriend
episodes.overview: Parents say their teen daughter is making dangerous choices and confront her much-older boyfriend for the first time; Nick Carter performs.

episodes.name: Rapper DMX: Disclosed: The Man Behind the Crime Headlines
episodes.overview: Rapper DMX discusses his drug addiction, erratic behavior, arrests and a streaking incident caught on tape.

episodes.name: Debt Denial?/Mama's Boy Moocher
episodes.overview: A woman living the high life suddenly falls deep in debt when her husband files for divorce; 28-year-old Steven still lives at home, on his parents' dime.

episodes.name: Explosive Anger
episodes.overview: Nichole's husband denies getting violent when he drinks; a couple say their son's rage is out of control and they fear for their lives; two survivors of a road-rage incident caught on tape tell their story.

episodes.name: Topless Photo Scandal: Beauty Queen Victim or Girl Gone Wild?
episodes.overview: A 19-year-old beauty queen says her career was ruined when young women sent compromising photos of her to pageant officials, and she faces one of the former friends who admits to sending the images.

episodes.name: Dangerous and Violent Love
episodes.overview: Bridgette says she is terrified of her abusive, controlling boyfriend, but she is too fearful to leave him; women who survived brutal attacks by their exes tell their stories.

episodes.name: Death in 6 Seconds: A Night of Drinking, a Lifetime of Regret
episodes.overview: A young woman who was the only survivor of a drunken driving accident that killed two of her friends tells of her subsequent reckless behavior and leaving others to care for her infant son.

episodes.name: A Drunken Mother's Rage
episodes.overview: Jessica's fiance says her anger and drinking are out of control, causing chaos in their blended family; the husband of a woman who lost 100 pounds does not support her transformation.

episodes.name: Ask Dr. Phil
episodes.overview: A woman wonders whether she should marry her brother-in-law to fulfill her deceased sister's dying wish; a wife says her shopping addiction is ruining her marriage; an obese former beauty queen asks why she is afraid to slim down.

episodes.name: Pretty Mean Girls
episodes.overview: Holly says her sister Andrea is ruining their relationship because of her bullying and attacks on people.

episodes.name: Munchausen Mom
episodes.overview: Tina's syndrome causes her to harm herself to get attention; Samantha fakes illnesses.

episodes.name: Threats, Fights and Videotape
episodes.overview: Two couples' explosive fights are caught on tape and destroying their marriages.

episodes.name: Pregnant at 11
episodes.overview: At 11 years old, Hope got pregnant with then 13-year-old Bailey's child.

episodes.name: Cougar Confessions/The Pippi Longstocking Sex Tape Scandal
episodes.overview: "Golden Sisters" Mary, Josie and Teresa; women who date much younger men; actress Tami Erin.

episodes.name: Torn Between My Mother and My Boyfriend
episodes.overview: Malinda says she is in love with a registered sex offender and does not plan to leave him, even though she has a 4-year-old daughter.

episodes.name: Cold Case Mystery: A Family Divided
episodes.overview: Family members take polygraph tests in an unsolved murder case.

episodes.name: Saving Loni: From the Suburbs to the Slums
episodes.overview: A couple say their 20-year-old daughter went from being a straight-A student to a heroin addict.

episodes.name: My Husband, My Boyfriend, My Big Decision
episodes.overview: Lisa says her longtime husband is verbally abusive and controlling, sending her into the arms of her boyfriend.

episodes.name: Bitter and Twisted
episodes.overview: A pair accuse each other of being a poor parent to their 16-year-old son; Alysia says her mother neglected her and her siblings, leaving her to be the mother figure.

episodes.name: Dad's Wife Is Ruining Our Life
episodes.overview: Allan wants a better relationship with his 38-year-old twin daughters, who he has been at odds with since their mother died more than a decade ago.

episodes.name: Stepdad Takes On Dr. Phil
episodes.overview: Brenda claims her husband, Drew, physically and verbally abuses her 14-year-old son and ridicules her 20-year-old daughter, who is intellectually disabled; he denies being abusive and says he is trying to prepare them for the real world.

episodes.name: Stepparent Abuse?
episodes.overview: Dr. Phil continues his discussion with Brenda and Drew, who are at odds over the way Brenda says he treats her two children; Dr. Phil's wife, Robin, has a strong message for the couple; Lauren says her 2-year-old daughter was murdered by her stepmom.

episodes.name: My Mother-in-Law Destroyed My Marriage
episodes.overview: Joey blames his wife's mother for the failure of his marriage; after learning that her husband had an affair with one of her friends, Ashley is afraid to let him out of her sight.

episodes.name: Teen Mom: Should They Kick Her Out?
episodes.overview: Valerie says her 19-year-old daughter, Alyssa, is a lazy, irresponsible mother who refuses to get a job and leaves her baby unattended; Alyssa says her mother and stepfather's strict rules make her feel like she's in prison; actor Antonio Sabato Jr.

episodes.name: When Love Hurts

episodes.name: Pregnant and Abusing Drugs: The Ultimatum

episodes.name: The Darkness of Riches: Born Billionaires but Starved, Abused and Locked in a Basement
episodes.overview: Teen twins, the only living heirs of the Duke tobacco fortune, tell of the abuse they suffered at the hands of their father.

episodes.name: The Darkness of Riches: From Victims to Victors
episodes.overview: In an exclusive interview, 16-year-old twins Georgia and Walker “Patterson” Inman, who, at 21, will reportedly inherit $1 billion as the only living heirs of the Duke tobacco fortune, open up to Dr. Phil about the abuse they claim they suffered for more than a decade. The twins were born into a family of prestige and extreme wealth -- vacationing on the beaches of Fiji, having wild animals as pets and bringing diamonds to school for show-and-tell -- but say their lives have been anything but privileged. After their parents divorced and their father, Walker Inman Jr., won custody, they claim they lived each day in a state of pure terror -- burned with boiling water, forced to live in a feces-filled basement and held prisoner behind dead-bolted doors. How do they say they survived years of alleged torture? Their father, whom they claim abused drugs, died of an overdose in 2010, and the teens were reunited with their mother, Daisha Inman, with whom they now live.

episodes.name: A Family Slaughtered for Teen Love: The Convicted Daughter Speaks Out
episodes.overview: Dr. Phil continues his exclusive interview with 16-year-old twins Georgia and Patterson Inman, heirs to the Duke tobacco fortune. How do they describe their relationship with their mom, Daisha, with whom they were estranged for most of their childhood? Then, Daisha opens up about her about her tumultuous relationship with the twins’ father, Walker Inman Jr., and why she says she was kept out of her children’s lives. Daisha, who is battling the bank for control of her children’s trust funds, which they gain access to when they turn 21, recently made headlines when she threatened to use an armed security team to scare away a process server. How does she answer to allegations that she is trying to drain the twins’ accounts and spend the money on lavish gifts? And, what do the kids have to say about their impending fortunes? Plus, Georgia and Patterson claim they survived years of abuse and neglect -- how can they move forward after the terror they say they endured?

episodes.name: My Family Slaughtered for My Daughter's Teenage Love: Can a Father Forgive?

episodes.name: Dr. Phil's 2000th Show

episodes.name: You're Not Hot Enough

episodes.name: A Mother Consumed With Rage: Is Her Anger Destroying Her Family?

episodes.name: I'm Afraid My Husband Is Going to Kill Me
episodes.overview: Caitlin says that her husband abuses her verbally and physically, at one point causing the loss of their unborn baby, and that he has been physical with their two young children, who are afraid of him; he says she abuses him as well.

episodes.name: Should I Marry My Controlling, Alienating, Jealous Fiance?
episodes.overview: Diane says her 17-year-old daughter, Brianna, is an out-of-control drug abuser who has run away from home at least five times and does not respect authority. She says she recently forced Brianna into a youth shelter, hoping it would scare the teen straight, but nothing has changed — and she fears for her daughter’s life. Diane also claims her ex-husband, Michael, abandoned Brianna after their divorce — and she feels that contributed to the teen’s downward spiral. How does Michael respond? And, what ownership does Diane take in the situation? Brianna says her mother is overreacting and insists she’s just living the partying lifestyle by using Xanax, Molly, marijuana, PCP, heroin and alcohol. But is there something deeper at play? Emotions run high when the family comes together on Dr. Phil’s stage — and an unexpected moment happens. Will Brianna realize the dangers she’s facing and get the help she needs?

episodes.name: I'm Over It!

episodes.name: My Sloppy, Lazy, Mooching Daughter Needs to Move Out!
episodes.overview: A young woman who refuses to go to college or get a job, steals from her parents and hangs out with a bad crowd blames her mother for her current situation.

episodes.name: My Daughter's Lies Are Tearing My Family Apart
episodes.overview: Lynn, 17, says her father molested and raped her three times, which he adamantly denies.

episodes.name: Daughter vs. Dad: The Truth Revealed
episodes.overview: Chris and his 17-year-old daughter, who claims he has molested and raped her three times, take polygraph tests.

episodes.name: Hands Off My Man!
episodes.overview: Theresa says her fiance's ex-girlfriend is jealous and obsessed with them, and Dr. Phil must intervene in the drama-filled love triangle.

episodes.name: I Believe My Ex Murdered Our Children
Parents Accused of Murder: Will Julia and Codey Agree to Take the Polygraph Test?
Michelle Knight One Year Later: Secrets of Cleveland's House of Horrors Revealed
My Beauty Queen Baby Girl Has Gone Ballistic
episodes.overview: Stephanie says her daughter went from a picture-perfect straight-A student and beauty-pageant queen to an out-of-control, violent drug abuser who has a gun and has threatened to kill her.

episodes.name: An Affair With a Friend Ended in a Bitter Custody Battle
episodes.overview: Amy says her friend's husband raped her and got her pregnant, and after an incident during a custody exchange, she took out a protective order against him; he says her accusations are revenge for him not leaving his wife.

episodes.name: Acquitted by a Jury, but My Ex-Husband Still Thinks I'm Guilty
episodes.overview: Michelle Knight, the first of three women abducted by Ariel Castro and held for more than a decade, first appeared on Dr. Phil last year and revealed the true story of what happened inside Cleveland’s notorious house of horrors. Now, one year after being rescued, Michelle says she is stronger, happier and finally free — and joins Dr. Phil for the first time ever in front of a live studio audience.

episodes.name: Dr. Phil's Big Ultimatum: Will Accused Mother Heather Go to Rehab?
Not-So-Sweet 16: My Daughter's Dangerous Sex Life
An Ultimatum for a Hoarding Mother: Her Kids or Her Clutter
episodes.overview: Four siblings say their mother's hoarding is so out of control that nearly every inch of her 9,000-square-foot home is filled with junk, and their father says he moved out of the house two years ago because of the mess.

episodes.name: Love Scams: I Married a Catfish Over the Phone
episodes.overview: Dr. Phil enlists a private investigator and other specialists to verify the claims of a woman's "heart husband," whom she has sent tens of thousands of dollars and has never met in person; a former guest returns with an update and words of wisdom.

episodes.name: Trapped by My Controlling Husband: I Feel Like I Can't Leave the House, Get a Job or Have a Phone!
Young, Gorgeous, Privileged and Destroying Her Family
V. Stiviano: The Woman Behind the Donald Sterling Scandal Takes Off Her Visor to Face Dr. Phil
Headbutted and Choked Unconscious: A Wife and Children Left in Fear
episodes.overview: Janette says her husband has recently become mentally, verbally and physically abusive to her and their three children, and she fears that his behavior could turn deadly; a woman's abusive boyfriend disfigured her with hot cooking oil.

episodes.name: Troubled Teen: Who Will Take Danielle?
episodes.overview: A fractured family is desperate to get help for a young teen who has a history of lying, acting out and showing inappropriate sexual behavior.

episodes.name: Family Dramas, Mysteries and Facing the Unknown
Tyrannical Teens
episodes.overview: Janette says in the past year, her husband, Clint, has turned into someone she doesn’t recognize. She says his temper is frightening, and he’s become mentally, verbally and physically abusive with her and their three children, and she’s afraid his behavior could turn deadly. Recently, Janette says one of their arguments escalated and ended with Clint choking her unconscious, while their 11-year-old son tried to pull his father off of her. Janette says there have been multiple incidents, and their children are now frightened of their father. Clint admits he has anger issues and gets physical with his wife but says she nags and provokes him until he snaps -- and he says she should be afraid of him when he’s angry.

episodes.name: Troubled Teen: Who Will Take Danielle?
episodes.overview: Exes Jeff and Valerie say they’re at a loss for how to help their 15-year-old daughter, Danielle, who they say has a history of lying, acting out and showing inappropriate sexual behavior. They say in kindergarten, Danielle began expressing herself sexually at school, and by second grade, was threatening physical harm and making sexually explicit comments to other students. They admit they have not been a united front while raising their daughter, who has been bounced around between them and her grandmothers while growing up.

episodes.name: Family Dramas, Mysteries and Facing the Unknown
episodes.overview: Dr. Phil taps into the spiritual world with help from the next generation of psychic mediums, Thomas John and Bill Philipps. When did they first realize they had psychic abilities? And, what messages will they have for guests, viewers, audience members and Dr. Phil staff? Then, recovering addict Kathie says her daughter, Whitney, refuses to forgive her for her past mistakes, and she wants to make amends. Whitney says her mother abandoned the family after Kathie’s mother passed away in 2002, leaving Whitney to fight for — and win — custody of her younger sister.

episodes.name: Tyrannical Teens
episodes.overview: Lavena says her 17-year-old son, Trevor’s, anger is out of control, and despite seeing mental health professionals for years, his behavior is growing more aggressive and defiant. She says Trevor screams, curses and breaks things during his rages and has even threatened to shoot people -- and never shows remorse for his actions. She says she fears he could snap and kill her, her husband, her 5-year-old twins -- or become the next school gunman.

episodes.name: Parental Alienation: Who’s to Blame?
episodes.overview: Sara says her ex-husband, Mark, has brainwashed their three grown children against her, and she just wants to reclaim a place in their lives. Mark and his new wife, Mikel, say they’re afraid of Sara but are willing to face her onstage with Dr. Phil. Can these exes put the past behind them and make peace? And, is Sara’s 22-year-old daughter willing to fix their broken relationship?

episodes.name: Saving Loni: From the Suburbs to the Slums
episodes.overview: Lynn and Paul say their 20-year-old daughter, Loni, went from a straight-A student to a heroin addict, and they’re desperate to get her help. After two felony arrests — including one for allegedly selling heroin to an undercover officer — Loni spent 30 days in rehab, but they say it wasn’t long before they discovered she was using heroin again — and stealing money and jewelry from family members to pay for it. Now, Lynn and Paul say Loni is living in a trailer with strangers, in the middle of nowhere, and they fear for her life. Dr. Phil sends mother-son intervention team Debbie and Brandon to track down Loni and offer her a chance to face her family and make a plan for a healthier future. Will Loni grab onto the lifeline?

episodes.name: Love, Lies, Scams, Murder
episodes.overview: In October 2013, Shay’s 19-year-old brother, Connor, was convicted of second-degree murder in the stabbing death of Shay’s boyfriend, Andrew, and sentenced to 20 to 60 years in prison. In a Dr. Phil exclusive, Shay and her parents share what they believe happened that night and why they feel Connor was acting in self-defense.

episodes.name: A Mother Consumed with Rage: Is Her Anger Destroying Her Family?
episodes.overview: Thirty-year-old Ashley admits she has an “extreme” anger problem and verbally and physically abuses her husband of eight years, Aaron — at times, in front of their 6-year-old son and 3-year-old daughter. She says she’s quick to become enraged, often screaming so loudly at Aaron that she loses her breath or blacks out — and she admits she once even punched him in the face while he was holding their baby. What’s at the root of her rage? And, why does Aaron — a former Marine who fought in the Iraq war — put up with this treatment? Plus, Ashley admits she also takes out her anger on her son by screaming in his face, and he’s now suffering from social and emotional issues. Dr. Phil sits the couple down in search of a resolution. Can Ashley learn to control her temper, for the sake of her children? And, can this marriage be saved?

episodes.name: Bully Teacher?/DNA Dilemma
episodes.overview: Former kindergarten teacher Cynthia says her life was torn apart when a classroom lesson led to her being convicted of official oppression, a misdemeanor, and sentenced to two years’ probation and 30 days in jail. Prosecutors claimed Cynthia told her students to line up and strike a 6-year-old boy, to teach him “how it feels to be bullied.” Cynthia says the whole ordeal was a big misunderstanding, and now she’s falsely labeled as a “bully teacher” — and might never lead a classroom again. How does she describe what happened that day?

episodes.name: Deadly Relations
episodes.overview: Bailey struggles to move on with her life after a terrifying home invasion and kidnapping; for 18 years, Jose was the prime suspect in the case of his missing girlfriend, until another man pleaded guilty to her murder.

episodes.name: Did Walt Kill His Ex-Girlfriend? The Polygraph Test Results Revealed!
episodes.overview: A 14-year-old's ex-boyfriend and her sister accuse each other of being involved in her death, and they both take polygraph tests.

episodes.name: Not-So-Sweet 16: “My Daughter’s Dangerous Sex Life”
episodes.overview: Fany and her husband, Markus, say they’re at their wits’ end with Fany’s 16-year-old daughter, Claire, who admittedly drinks, smokes marijuana and has sex with numerous partners. Dr. Phil has some tough questions for the teen about her choices — and for Fany and Markus about their parenting. How can Claire get back on track?

episodes.name: Vanished on Vacation: Beautiful Blonde Goes Missing in Aruba
episodes.overview: Dr. Phil sits down with Gary Giordano, who was considered the prime suspect in the disappearance of traveling companion Robyn Gardner in 2011 Aruba, and offers him a polygraph test.

episodes.name: Exclusive: The Father Acquitted of Murdering the Drunk Driver Who Killed His Sons
episodes.overview: Dr. Phil sits down with David and Cindy Barajas weeks after David was acquitted of murder charges in the shooting death of the drunken driver who killed their two young sons.

episodes.name: Sons of Guns Reality Show Scandal: The Daughter Speaks Out
episodes.overview: Dr. Phil sits down with Stephanie Hayden, daughter of Will Hayden ("Sons of Guns"), who has been accused of raping a 12-year-old girl, and continues his interview with the father acquitted of murder charges in a drunken driver's death.

episodes.name: Get Out of My House: The Ultimate Mother-Nanny Feud
episodes.overview: A mother and her former live-in nanny come face to face on Dr. Phil's stage after the nanny refuses to leave the family's home.

episodes.name: Exclusive: The Mother Who Attempted to Kill Herself and Her Autistic Daughter
episodes.overview: Issy Stapleton's mother discusses her attempt to kill herself and Issy.

episodes.name: Exclusive: Kelli Stapleton: A Mother's Worst Nightmare
episodes.overview: Issy Stapleton's mother discusses her attempt to kill herself and Issy; warning signs; how viewers can help Issy secure a healthy and productive future.

episodes.name: Is Mom Leading a Secret Life, or Are These Daughters Caught Up in Drama?
episodes.overview: Sisters say their mother is leading a secret sex life while maintaining the facade of a happy marriage; she says they are stirring up drama with half-truths and misinformation and need to butt out.

episodes.name: NFL Domestic Violence: There Are No Sidelines, Only Sides
episodes.overview: Retired NFL player Chris Johnson discusses domestic violence and former teammate Ray Rice; Trichele says she shot and killed her husband in self-defense after years of domestic abuse.

episodes.name: My Mom Ruined My Life by Keeping Me from My Dad
episodes.overview: Monica says her 13-year-old daughter is angry, violent and out-of-control; the girl says her mother is abusive and has kept her away from her father; Robin McGraw makes an announcement.

episodes.name: I Spanked My Wife With a Wooden Spoon, and She Needs to Repent
episodes.overview: Renee videotapes her husband abusing her, sending him to jail.

episodes.name: My Husband Spanked Me With a Wooden Spoon, and He Wants Me to Apologize?!
episodes.overview: Renee records her husband's abuse of her, sending him to jail; updates on memorable guests.

episodes.name: E.R. Visits, Nearly 100 Calls to Police: Should They Redo Their I Dos?
episodes.overview: Jaime says she divorced her husband because he is abusive; he says she pushes his buttons until he blows up; they are considering reuniting for the sake of their child.

episodes.name: Two Mothers Facing the Unthinkable
episodes.overview: Actress Kelly Rutherford's children were ordered to live with their father in France; a 12-year-old has Tourette's syndrome.

episodes.name: He's Nearly 30 and Engaged to My Teen With Braces
episodes.overview: Jean says her 17-year-old daughter was the all-American girl until she began dating a 28-year-old divorced father; a look at the man's history.

episodes.name: My Ex Won't Stop Videotaping and Posting Our Out of Control Son's Tantrums
episodes.overview: A woman needs help controlling her 7-year-old son.

episodes.name: The War of the Larosa's
episodes.overview: A couple who got married after only eight weeks of knowing each other try to solve their marital problems.

episodes.name: Love Scams: My Mother Sent Her Catfish 300k Plus 3 Cars
episodes.overview: A 70-year-old woman wants to move to Ghana to be with her online fiance -- even though they have never met.

episodes.name: Family on Fire: Caught on Tape
episodes.overview: Parents try to figure out why their teen daughter has daily, violent breakdowns.

episodes.name: I'm Afraid of My Mother: Does She Really Have Multiple Personalities

episodes.overview: Trisha and Danielle say they are convinced that the heiress their father met online is really a "catfish."

episodes.name: A Family's Battle With a Violent, Homicidal, Schizophrenic Son
episodes.overview: Sharon and Robert say their 25-year-old son is so violent and explosive that they are afraid he might follow through with his repeated threats and kill someone.

episodes.name: An Online Hate Group is Stalking Us and Ruining Our Lives
episodes.overview: A couple say they are being terrorized by an online hate group, led by a disgruntled former employee, after they closed their business.

episodes.name: My Honor Roll Teen is Pregnant by Her 30-Year-Old Bad Boy
episodes.overview: A teen says she got pregnant on purpose so her family would have to accept her abusive 30-year-old ex-con boyfriend.

episodes.name: My Scheming, Lying, Swindling Sister
episodes.overview: Lisa says her half-sister's web of deceit includes forging checks and lying about the deaths of her father and brother.

episodes.name: Give My Daughter Back or Get Out of My Life!
episodes.overview: Dana, who has struggled with drugs in the past, is furious that her sister refuses to relinquish temporary guardianship of Dana's teen daughte

episodes.overview: Parents say their 24-year-old son has extreme anger issues and threatens to kill them; he says they disrespect and antagonize him.

episodes.name: My Husband Kidnapped My Kids 45 Years Ago -- Help Me Find Them!
episodes.overview: Professional locator Troy Dunn reunites Dottie with two of her three children who she says were abducted by their father four decades ago.

episodes.name: A Father Accused: The Search for the Truth
episodes.overview: Megan says her father raped her while she was unconscious after a night of partying; both agree to take polygraph tests.

episodes.overview: A couple say they are fed up with their adult son, who is lazy, unmotivated and still living at home on their dime; he says he wants to live on his own, but his part-time, minimum-wage job does not allow it.

episodes.name: Why is My Prince Charming Hurting Me?
episodes.overview: Beth says her live-in boyfriend is a liar, cheater, alcoholic and narcissist who verbally abuses her daily, and she worries about the toll it is taking on their many children.

episodes.name: Who's Stalking Who?: Two Women Obsessed
episodes.overview: Canda says she has been cyberstalked and bullied for three years by a woman she has never met.

episodes.name: Footsteps in the Snow: The Cold Case Murder of Maria Ridulph
episodes.overview: Despite maintaining his innocence, Jack McCullough, once known as John Tessier, is convicted of the 1957 murder of 7-year-old Maria Ridulph.

episodes.name: A Real-Life “Catch Me if You Can”: Is This the World's Greatest Teen Con Artist?
episodes.overview: Young Matthew Scheidt is convicted of impersonating a physician assistant and practicing medicine without a license, and later is accused of impersonating a police officer.

episodes.name: Bob and Dorothy Return: “Should I Divorce My Wife for Harassing Me?”
episodes.overview: A quarreling couple come back to the show, their relationship worse than ever.

episodes.name: Handsome and Homeless: A Down-and-Out Romeo
episodes.overview: Viral-video star "Homeless Joe" survives on the streets of Manhattan by panhandling and picking up women.

episodes.name: Bright, Beautiful and Blowing It: “Help My Teen Before It's Too Late!”
episodes.overview: Fifteen-year-old Emily's mother says she uses drugs and causes constant chaos, and her stepfather would prefer that she move out.

episodes.name: Minny and Lon Return: “What Can We Do to Get Our Children Out of Foster Care?”
episodes.overview: After teen Andrue attempted to take his own life, his three younger siblings were removed from their parents' care based on his testimony of abuse; the parents, now separated, point fingers at each other.

episodes.name: Abused Wife Refuses to Leave Her Pro Fighter Husband
episodes.overview: Kaitlyn's professional-fighter husband speaks out from behind bars after being accused of assaulting her on two separate occasions over one weekend; she says she will not divorce him and blames her mother for meddling.

episodes.name: Death on 5th Avenue: Millionaire Mom Accused of Murdering Son Speaks from Rikers Island
episodes.overview: Millionaire socialite Gigi Jordan admits to killing her 8-year-old son but says that she did it to protect him.

episodes.name: The Mystery of Michelle O'Connell: A Family Divided
episodes.overview: The shooting death of a young mother divides her family after authorities conclude she took her own life.

episodes.name: Three Daughters, Three Addicts, One Family Being Torn Apart
episodes.overview: Parents enable three 20-something women who are all hooked on heroin; Dr. Phil offers the sisters help, with one big, non-negotiable condition.

episodes.name: Lethal Love: “We Believe Our Son's Girlfriend Killed Him”
episodes.overview: A young man's parents and girlfriend blame each other for his accidental overdose death.

episodes.name: The Secret World of Sugar Babies & Kendra Wilkinson on Top
episodes.overview: A woman and her daughter defend their lifestyle of dating wealthy, married men for money; a sugar baby confesses to her fiance; reality TV star Kendra Wilkinson.

episodes.name: Shocking Accusations: A Husband Poisoned? A Hit and Run?
episodes.overview: Nikki says her husband, and the father of her two young children, has become abusive; he says she may be trying to kill him.

episodes.name: Hypochondriac, High Drama or Really Sick? “My Sister's Illnesses are Destroying Our Family”
episodes.overview: Shemida says she has been diagnosed with more than 70 health conditions, but her family members say she is fabricating some of them.

episodes.name: Hypochondriac, High Drama or Really Sick? Saving Shemida
episodes.overview: Family members say Shemida's 70-plus diagnoses are tearing their family apart.

episodes.name: Blacklisted by Mom: “Can We Speak to Our Dad Before He Dies?”
episodes.overview: Four siblings say their mother has blacklisted them from the family and will not allow them to see their father, who is dying of bone cancer.

episodes.name: Survivor Todd's Shocking Relapse: The Life or Death Intervention
episodes.overview: The family of Todd Herzog ("Survivor: China") say he has fallen off the wagon and must return to the show for another alcohol-addiction intervention.

episodes.name: Will Survivor Todd Take Dr. Phil’s Help? Plus, What Happened to “Homeless Joe”?
episodes.overview: Dr. Phil continues his efforts to get Todd Herzog ("Survivor: China") the lifesaving treatment he needs; an update on "Homeless Joe," who was offered help for his alcoholism on an earlier show; former Ariel Castro captive Michelle Knight.

episodes.name: The “Here Comes Honey Boo Boo” Scandal: Mama June Speaks Out
episodes.overview: June "Mama June" Shannon, mother of 9-year-old reality TV star Alana "Honey Boo Boo" Thompson, discusses rumors that she is dating a convicted sex offender.

episodes.name: Exclusive: The Boy under the Stairs? What Did His Stepmom Know? Plus, Uncle Poodle Responds to Mama June
episodes.overview: The stepmother of a severely malnourished 5-year-old who was found locked in a small closet in his home says she had no idea what was happening to him; Honey Boo Boo's Uncle Poodle tells why he says Mama June is lying.

episodes.name: A Dentist's Dilemma: “My Ex-Wife and Ex-Girlfriend Are Plotting against Me!”
episodes.overview: Rick says his ex-wife and ex-girlfriend have teamed up to ruin his life by keeping him away from his child; they say he is controlling and abusive, and they fear he is a danger.

episodes.name: Molested for over 10 Years: “Why Won't My Grandma Believe Me?”
episodes.overview: Adult sisters confront their grandmother, who denies that her now-imprisoned husband molested them for many years.

episodes.name: Grandma Returns: Will She Finally Apologize for Her Molester Husband?
episodes.overview: Sisters' grandmother refuses to acknowledge that her husband sexually abused them; what parents need to know to keep their children safe.

episodes.name: “My Drunken Daughter Will Die if She Doesn't Stop Drinking Hand Sanitizer”
episodes.overview: Alcohol addict Kristine resorts to drinking hand sanitizer as a cheap way to get her fix and blames her dysfunctional family for her inability to stay sober.

episodes.name: “My Father Offered Me as a 'Maiden' Sacrifice to an Alleged Cult Leader”
episodes.overview: Lindsay claims her father turned a blind eye to her sexual abuse by a cult leader from the ages of 13 to 23.

episodes.name: “My Wife or My Girlfriend? Dr. Phil, You Decide”
episodes.overview: Melvin's wife and girlfriend meet for the first time, and he demands that Dr. Phil choose between them for him.

episodes.name: Cyberbullied After My Son's Death
episodes.overview: A grieving mother says a former friend is harassing her online; a woman's 15-year-old daughter killed herself after being cyberbullied by a man she had never met.

episodes.name: A Daughter on the Brink: Did Mom Push Her Over the Edge?
episodes.overview: Dana says her 23-year-old daughter is a drug addict who has ripped apart their family; the young woman blames her mother for pushing her buttons.

episodes.name: “My Fight With Food Is Ruining My Life”
episodes.overview: Two friends pack on the pounds together; a woman says she does not deserve love or marriage unless she loses weight; a former fitness model hates what she looks like; Dr. Phil introduces a new weight-loss plan.

episodes.name: Gold Digger or Girl in Danger?
episodes.overview: Andre says his sister preys on men with money and power, and he fears that her sexy, scheming ways may get her killed.

episodes.name: “I Thought My Daughter Was Abducted”: Why Does This Pretty 16-Year-Old Keep Going Missing?
episodes.overview: Teen Layton has run away from home more than 20 times in the last eight months and admits that she will do it again.

episodes.name: “My Husband Used to Abuse Me, So Now I'm Abusing Him”
episodes.overview: Teresa says her husband cheated on her and was abusive until he got help with his anger, and now she is full of rage and directs her anger at him, often in front of their children.

episodes.name: “My Bulimic Daughter Thinks Calories are Contagious”
episodes.overview: Fifteen-year-old Bella binges and purges 30 to 40 times a day, washes her hands obsessively, changes her clothes several times a day and holds her breath so she does not "catch calories."

episodes.name: A Woman's Memories of Murder: Was There a Crime or Another Traumatic Event?
episodes.overview: Lauren says she was kidnapped, sold into sex slavery and witnessed a woman's murder, but the police do not believe her story.

episodes.name: The Cougar Controversy: Older Women Dating Younger Men
episodes.overview: Three women date men 20 to 30 years their junior.

episodes.name: The “Honey Boo Boo” Scandal: Chickadee and Grandma Speak Out
episodes.overview: Anna "Chickadee" Cardwell ("Here Comes Honey Boo Boo"), her grandmother and Uncle Poodle discuss Mama June Shannon's relationship with a pedophile.

episodes.name: Black and Blue: Race Relations in America
episodes.overview: Family members of Eric Garner, who died after being put in a chokehold by a police officer; the mother of Michael Brown, who was shot and killed by an officer in Ferguson, Mo.; NFL player Ben Watson; college students say they were racially profiled.

episodes.name: Young, in Love and in over Their Heads
episodes.overview: Young Natalie says her boyfriend has a violent anger problem and she fears for her life and that of their 10-month-old son.

episodes.name: Is Dad a Bad Santa or Should His Son Be Put on the Naughty List?
episodes.overview: A 32-year-old who still lives at home hates his father so much he wishes the man would die; his father says he is an entitled mooch who could never survive on his own; a professional trainer meets his long-lost son; Jackie Evancho performs.

episodes.name: The Night Four Girls Went into the Woods and Only Three Came Out Alive
episodes.overview: A 17-year-old girl is sentenced to 23 years behind bars for luring a friend into the woods and killing her; Shemida, whose family accuses her of fabricating health problems for attention, returns to the show.

episodes.name: “I'm Divorcing the Real-Life Mommy Dearest”
episodes.overview: Jamie says his estranged wife verbally attacks their two children constantly, and the drama has gotten so bad that he got a protection order against her; Jennifer denies being abusive but confesses to a disturbing and dangerous behavior.

episodes.name: Inside the Bill Cosby Sex Scandal

episodes.name: Mom vs. Dad: Who is Responsible for Their Daughter's Big Relapse?
episodes.overview: Former guest Andee says she completed 90 days of drug rehab, then relapsed and is now worse than ever.

episodes.name: Get Off My Back About My Body
episodes.overview: Guests want to lose weight, but their loved ones are making it more difficult.

episodes.name: “My Mother is a Menace! She is Controlling My Daughter with Her Money and Turning Her against Me!”
episodes.overview: Dixie says her daughter has always been more interested in partying than in being a good mom, so her teenager is better off living with grandma.

episodes.name: “Dr. Phil, Save My Family”
episodes.overview: A couple say their 9-year-old son terrorizes the family and may be dangerous; relatives say he is overmedicated and under-parented.

episodes.overview: Teens record their wild behavior and post it online for the world to see; a 15-year-old becomes an Internet sensation for hitting another girl with a shovel; a man sets himself on fire in order to gain video views; an anti-bullying challenge.

episodes.name: Pretty, Young and Violent
episodes.overview: Teen girl bullies and bully victims move in together at the Dr. Phil House.

episodes.name: Why is My Mom Faking Cancer?

episodes.name: 15 and a Teenage Terror
episodes.overview: Josie, 15, has been kicked out of school and is facing battery and runaway charges, and Dr. Phil has some tough questions for her mother.

episodes.name: “My Parents Won't Accept My Controlling Pastor Husband”
episodes.overview: Sarah says her parents will not stop meddling in her eight-year marriage; they say her husband is bad news.

episodes.name: “Who Am I Married to: My Mother or My Man?”
episodes.overview: Sarah's parents, who say her husband is bad news, come face to face with his parents for the first time since the wedding; a grandmother may be putting her grandchild at risk.

episodes.name: “My Family Doesn’t Know I’m a College-Aged Sugar Baby”
episodes.overview: Young Michelle tells her family that she has been making a living by dating older men and being pampered with perks; an update on a past guest who revealed to her fiance that she was a sugar baby.

episodes.name: What Happened to Tempest?: Standing Up to Mean Girls
episodes.overview: Dr. Phil sits down with the mothers of teen girl bullies and bully victims to find out if they really know what is going on in their daughters' lives; dealing with mean girls; how victims of bullying can take back their power.

episodes.name: Parental Alienation or Runaway Sisters?: “Help Me Find My Teen Daughters”
episodes.overview: Brian says his two teen daughters vanished while visiting their mother, and he thinks she is hiding the girls; their older sister says she believes they ran away to avoid Brian, who she says is controlling and abusive.

episodes.name: “I'm Scared of My Sister's Boyfriend”: Is He a Danger to Her Children?
episodes.overview: Tracy thinks her sister's boyfriend may have sexually abused her sister's two granddaughters, but the couple say the children's mother coached them to lie.

episodes.name: Shocking Viral Video: Teen Says, “If Your Boyfriend Hits You, It's a Sign of Love”
episodes.overview: A video blogger sparks outcry by telling girls that if a man hits a woman it is a sign of love; Jessica admits she fabricated evidence against her ex-boyfriend.

episodes.name: From Top TV Newscaster to Drunken Mom
episodes.overview: Emmy-winning news reporter Christi's struggle with alcohol leaves her jobless, sleeping in bushes and estranged from her adult daughters, whom she faces for the first time in two years.

episodes.name: Gorgeous, Violent, Raging and a Very Unsweet 16
episodes.overview: Parents say 16-year-old Kristi is angry and violent, refuses to go to school, smokes marijuana and has no respect for authority.

episodes.name: A Family Divided over an Unsolved Murder
episodes.overview: Penny confronts her father, who she thinks hired a hit man to kill her sister.

episodes.name: “Is My Wife Real or a Nigerian Love Scam?”
episodes.overview: Steve has sent more than $100,000 to a woman to whom he believes he is married but has never met in person.

episodes.name: “Don't Give My Daughter Money: She is Lying about Dying from Cancer”
episodes.overview: Lynn, 30, says she has numerous medical conditions, including cancer and heart disease, but her mother says it is all lies in order to gain money and attention.

episodes.name: “My 21-Year-Old Daughter is Obsessed with Her Controlling, Jealous, Heroin-Addicted Boyfriend”
episodes.overview: Alyssa and Steve say their daughter had a promising future until she met a young man who led her down a dark and dangerous path.

episodes.name: Our Son Was Making Millions, but is Now Living in Our Garage with His Girlfriend
episodes.overview: Mike and Vicki say their 37-year-old son was once making millions of dollars running a successful real estate company, but now lives with them, on their dime; he blames them for his current living situation.

episodes.name: Exclusive: The Vanderbilt Football Player’s Interview from behind Bars
episodes.overview: One of two former Vanderbilt University football players who were found guilty of raping an unconscious female classmate in a campus dorm room after a night of drinking tells his story.

episodes.name: Pretty Little Mean Girls
episodes.overview: Three 20-somethings say they have all been victims of cyberbullying at the hands of one young woman.

episodes.name: “Our Sister Lived in the Bushes and Tried to Hire Someone to Kill Her”
episodes.overview: Women say their sister lives in a world of make-believe, and she once paid a homeless man to try to kill her, so they would think she was dead.

episodes.name: Parenting While Intoxicated
episodes.overview: Three sisters say their mother's alcoholism is destroying their family; she says her husband has a drinking problem too.

episodes.name: Riches to Rags: “My Son's Fiancée is Ruining His Life”
episodes.overview: A woman says her son has gone from working a well-paying job to homeless and living in the woods because of his fiancee.

episodes.name: The Student and the Professor: Is One Stalking the Other?
episodes.overview: Dr. Phil tries to unravel the truth about a toxic relationship between a professor and one of her students.

episodes.name: “My 4-Year-Old Daughter Crushes Her Candy Like Her Dad Crushes His Pain Pills”
episodes.overview: Whitney says her ex-boyfriend is an unfit father, and they are embroiled in a custody battle over their 4-year-old daughter.

episodes.name: The Ultimate Betrayal: A Toxic Family Love Triangle
episodes.overview: Caroline and Sonny's tumultuous, possibly abusive marriage situation becomes worse after Sonny cheats on his wife with her sister.

episodes.name: “My Ex is Evil; I Want to See My Kids”
episodes.overview: Kimberly refuses to let her ex see their three children, saying he is unstable and irresponsible.

episodes.name: “My Sister Published a Book of Lies about Our Family”
episodes.overview: Jori publishes a novel she says is partly based on her life, including abuse she claims she suffered at the hands of her deceased mother.

episodes.name: Time is Running Out for Prison-Bound Dad: Did His Wife Blackmail Him into Embezzling $300,000?
episodes.overview: Siblings say their mother chooses alcohol over them, and with their father headed to prison, they are afraid their family will fall apart if she does not get her act together.

episodes.name: “I Believe My Cousin is Squandering Her Inheritance on a Love Scam”
episodes.overview: A woman admits she has sent more than $1 million to her online boyfriend, whom she has never met in person; viewers join the effort to track down the man.

episodes.name: A Modern Day Bonnie and Clyde, or Confused Teens in Love?
episodes.overview: Dr. Phil speaks with Dalton Hayes, an 18-year-old man who, with a 13-year-old girl, went on a two-week, multi-state crime spree, stealing cars, destroying property and forging checks.

episodes.name: “I Am the Outcast of My Family, and They Threw Me Away Like Trash!”
episodes.overview: A young woman says her family treated her like an outcast during her childhood and turned their backs on her when she was 17; they deny rejecting her but say they do not agree with her controversial lifestyle.

episodes.name: “My Husband's Big Lottery Win is Ruining Our Marriage”
episodes.overview: A woman says that ever since her husband won $1.66 million in a lottery pool, he has become angry, distant and secretive.

episodes.name: “My Wife Chose Her Boyfriend over Her Children”
episodes.overview: George says his estranged wife is an unfit mother and a serial cheater who puts boyfriends ahead of her six children.

episodes.name: Young, Jealous Love
episodes.overview: Ilene says her boyfriend is ruining their relationship with his jealousy and controlling behavior, and nothing she has done to prove her fidelity has eased his suspicions.

episodes.name: Adoption Nightmare: “I Want My Baby Back”
episodes.overview: Kristen says her baby's adoptive parents promised she could remain in their child's life and then reneged; they say her unstable behavior is the problem, and she is pregnant again

episodes.name: “My Daughter Hasn't Spoken to Me in 7 Years: What's Wrong with Her?”
episodes.overview: Jen says her mother should apologize to her for decades of pain, drama and lies; the pair face each other for the first time in seven years.

episodes.name: In Sickness and in Health: “Should I Get a Divorce from My OCD Wife?”
episodes.overview: Laura has a list of 91 fears and rituals, and her husband says her OCD is taking such a toll on their relationship and family that he is considering divorce.

episodes.name: “Our 7-Year-Old Son Threatens to Kill Us!”
episodes.overview: Adoptive parents say 7-year-old Rylan has a fascination with knives, talks to an imaginary friend who tells him to kill his entire family, and has sent two teachers to the hospital.

episodes.name: Exclusive: Bobbi Kristina’s Boyfriend, Distraught and Out of Control: The Nick Gordon Intervention
episodes.overview: Nick Gordon, boyfriend of Bobbi Kristina Brown, says he blames himself for not being able to save her or her mother, Whitney Houston; his mother says she fears for his life as he becomes increasingly self-destructive; Dr. Phil stages an intervention.

episodes.name: Inside the Mind of the Man Who Shot the “American Sniper”: A Dr. Phil Exclusive
episodes.overview: The parents and sister of Eddie Ray Routh, convicted of killing U.S. Navy SEAL Chris Kyle and friend Chad Littlefield, talk about his behavior.

episodes.name: Nine Seconds that Outraged a Nation/“My Racist Father Needs to Accept the Minorities in My Family”
episodes.overview: A 9-second video of college students singing a racist chant sparks outrage; a KKK member's daughter has a biracial baby.

episodes.name: Young, Beautiful and Missing/“Homeless Joe” Returns
episodes.overview: Ashley Summers, 14, disappears in 2007 Cleveland; Michelle Parker disappears the day she and her ex appear together on "The People's Court"; an update on former guest "Homeless Joe."

episodes.name: Lifetime Grudge: Can Mother and Daughter Finally Bury the Hatchet?
episodes.overview: A young woman wants an apology from her mother for what she says were years of abuse; an update on former guests Candi and Lyndsey.

episodes.name: 1,000 Lies and Counting: A Husband Who Can't Tell the Truth
episodes.overview: Melisa says her estranged husband is a pathological liar who lies about anything and everything; he insists he wants to change.

episodes.name: Help! My Daughter is Addicted to Dangerous Men
episodes.overview: Rhonda says her 18-year-old daughter puts herself in harm's way by pursuing dangerous men; Vickey suspects that her violent ex may have had something to do with the disappearance of a pregnant woman; Robin surprises a shelter for women and children.

episodes.name: “Falsely Accused of Murder and Now My Life is Spiraling out of Control”
episodes.overview: Kezia says her daughter has spiraled out of control since witnessing her best friend's murder and being wrongly accused of the crime

episodes.name: Flirty Emails and Suspicious Photos: “Is My Husband a Cheater or Just a Charmer?”
episodes.overview: Sarah has spent years gathering evidence to try to prove that her husband has been unfaithful; the couple's teen son talks about how their behavior affects him and his brother.

episodes.name: Decades of Hatred, Accusations and Altercations: A Fight for Custody That's Tearing a Mother and Daughter Apart
episodes.overview: A mother and daughter in conflict about the daughter's past drug use and efforts to reform seek assistance from Dr. Phil.

episodes.name: “Is Our Son a Kleptomaniac?”
episodes.overview: Nancy and Mark say their 18-year-old son, Chris, regularly steals from family, friends and neighbors, and Chris admits to it.

episodes.name: “I've Divorced My Ex Twice, but I'm Still in Love”
episodes.overview: Gwen and Derrick say they would love to be together, if the other would change.

episodes.name: “My Mother Gambled $2.5 Million Away and Blames Me for Being Broke”
episodes.overview: Diane says Carie was never there when she needed her daughter, and Carie says her mother blames her own financial woes on Carie.

episodes.name: A Beautiful Teen Forced to Live a Horrible Nightmare: “I Was Held Captive by an Online 'Friend'”
episodes.overview: A 17-year-old is haunted by three weeks spent as a sex slave while being held captive by an online friend.

episodes.name: “My Husband Makes Me Think I'm Crazy, Then Videotapes Me:” Accusations of Abuse Caught on Camera
episodes.overview: Pregnant Melinda says her husband is a controlling and abusive drug-user and she worries about their 1-year-old son.

episodes.name: “Keep My Ex-Daughter-in-Law Away From My Family”
episodes.overview: Thelma says her former daughter-in-law was a terrible wife and mother who abandoned her children but still takes money from their father.

episodes.name: Accusations of Beatings, Starvation and Being Locked in a Room: Who’s Telling the Truth?
episodes.overview: Beth says she grew up in a "house of horrors" at the hands of her mother, who denies her accusations of abuse and neglect.

episodes.name: A Family Fighting over a Double-Murder/Psychic Medium John Edward Returns!
episodes.overview: Angela says her nephew is in prison for murder because his wife lied under oath, and the women face each other for the first time since the trial; psychic medium John Edward gives Dr. Phil a personal reading and has a message for Angela.

episodes.name: An Ex Accused of Stalking, Obsession and Abuse: Who's Telling the Truth?
episodes.overview: Jennifer says her ex-husband calls her 100 times a week and sneaks into her house to go through her belongings; five siblings tell of their mother being beaten to death by her boyfriend; three sisters lost their mother to domestic violence.

episodes.name: “I Believe My Parents are Enabling My Freeloading, Drug-Using, Model Brother & It Needs to Stop Today!”
episodes.overview: Anthony says his 29-year-old brother has struggled for years with cocaine, alcohol and anger issues, and their parents give him money.

episodes.name: My Model Brother Wants My Parents to Keep His Secret — Why He Stormed Off the Stage
episodes.overview: Model Jamie admits to struggling with drug and alcohol addiction, and has another serious problem that he refuses to discuss; a follow-up on the Nick Gordon intervention.

episodes.name: Cleveland Abduction: The Michelle Knight Movie and the Brutal Scenes She Couldn't Face
episodes.overview: Michelle Knight, held captive by Ariel Castro for a decade; actors Taryn Manning and Raymond Cruz ("Cleveland Abduction"); Renatta says she has turned to food to cope with losing family members to addiction.

episodes.name: A Deadly Love Affair: The Widow, The Lover and The Spouse Behind Bars
episodes.overview: A small-town man is sentenced to 30 years in prison for murdering his wife's married lover; the wives come face to face for the first time since the trial.

episodes.name: Exclusive: The Co-Eds and the Catfish
episodes.overview: Seven college students face the man with whom they fell in love online, but never met in person; he, too, says he was victimized, by a catfish who stole his identity; the real person who lured the young women into fake relationships comes forward.

episodes.name: Was It Child Abuse, or Was It an Accident?
episodes.overview: Brenda and Josh say their baby was taken from them after she accidentally fell off Josh's lap, and he is now in prison.

episodes.name: Real Housewife’s Exclusive: Kim Richards Tells All about Drunken Arrest
episodes.overview: Kim Richards ("The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills") discusses her ongoing battle with alcoholism and her April 2015 arrest.

episodes.name: The College Professor and His Many Women
episodes.overview: Tensions run high as "master manipulator" Winston faces his estranged wife, former fiancee and ex-wife.

episodes.name: “My Stepmother Blew All of My Father's Money on a Scam Artist!”
episodes.overview: Kaye, 70, has sent more than $200,000 to her online boyfriend, whom she has never met in person; stepdaughter Kathy is angry that Kaye is wasting her late father's hard-earned money on a scammer.

episodes.name: Uncovering a Catfish: The Battle Between Kaye & Kathy Continues
episodes.overview: Kaye, 70, has sent more than $200,000 to her online boyfriend, whom she has never met in person; Kathy is angry that Kaye is wasting her late father's hard-earned money on a scammer; the results of Dr. Phil's investigation into "Aaron."

episodes.name: Family's Fight over Father's Inheritance
episodes.overview: Lisa accuses her father of tampering with his mother's will and stealing an inheritance she believes was intended to go to her and her sisters, and says he is throwing it away on a Russian mail-order bride.

episodes.name: A Family Divided: Why is Outspoken Dad Carl Boycotting His Daughter's Wedding?
episodes.overview: Carl is boycotting his daughter Lisa's upcoming wedding because of an inheritance squabble and says he doubts he is her real father.

episodes.name: “My Cyberbullied Daughter Killed Herself, Now I'm Being Harassed Online by a Stranger”
episodes.overview: Two years after her 12-year-old daughter took her own life because of cyberbullying, Tricia says she is being harassed online by a stranger who shares the girl's name; the two women come face to face for the first time.

episodes.name: Convicted Grandpa Still Claims He is Innocent of Molestation
episodes.overview: Betty says her young grandson's step-grandmother coached him to say that her husband touched him inappropriately.

episodes.name: Convicted Grandpa Accused of Molestation Finally Speaks Out
episodes.overview: Bill discusses pleading no contest to felony child abuse despite maintaining his innocence and hears the results of his polygraph test.

episodes.name: “I'm Not Unstable; Give Me My Children Back”
episodes.overview: Jennifer says her parents fraudulently gained temporary custody of her 6-year-old and turned her young adult children against her; they say she is mentally ill and they had no choice but to intervene.

episodes.name: A Mother Accused of Being Unfit and Unstable: Did Jennifer Pass the Drug Test?
episodes.overview: Jennifer fights her parents for custody of her 6-year-old; Dr. Phil reads the results of her drug test; her 20-year-old son tells his side of the story; a backstage showdown.

episodes.name: Behind the Buggies and Bonnets: Amish Mafia Star Under Attack
episodes.overview: Nemeses Levi and Merlin ("Amish Mafia") feud over Levi's new book and exploitation of the Amish for fame and fortune.

episodes.name: Young and Beautiful: But Their Love is Ugly
episodes.overview: Crystal and James say their on again/off again relationship is riddled with lies and accusations of abuse, neglect and bad parenting; Dr. Phil and fellow talk-show host Steve Harvey face off in a series of challenges.

episodes.name: Mother of the Year Turned Stalker: Terrorizes Couple for Outbidding Her on Dream Home
episodes.overview: Kathy, a former "Mother of the Year," stalks a young couple after they outbid her on a dream home, engaging in a yearlong campaign to annoy and embarrass them.

episodes.name: “My Friends Shaved Their Heads and Got Tattoos Because I Had Cancer, but It Was All a Lie”
episodes.overview: Friends and family raise thousands of dollars to help pay medical bills for Meaghan, 25, who tells them she has terminal cancer; more than a year later, she confesses that it was all a lie and pleads not guilty to charges of grand theft and fraud.

episodes.name: Teacher Scandal Confession: She Had Sex with Her 15-Year-Old Student
episodes.overview: A former middle-school teacher tells of being charged with rape after police found her in a motel room with a 15-year-old former student, 650 miles from their hometown.

episodes.name: A Wife Goes Missing: Is Her Husband to Blame?
episodes.overview: Julie's family fears that her husband killed her, while he blames her ex and refuses to speak to Dr. Phil until her family leaves; murdered teen Dylan Redwine's mother returns with an update, and his dad gets another chance to take a polygraph.

episodes.name: She Left Her Babies Alone in a Car: Criminal or Mom Misunderstood?
episodes.overview: Shanesha tells of being charged with child abuse for leaving her two young sons alone in a hot car while she attended a job interview and responds to those who say she misused monetary donations from sympathetic supporters.

episodes.name: Mentally Ill or Monster? Teen Convicted of Murdering Mom with a Sledgehammer Speaks
episodes.overview: Teen Zachary Davis sits down with Dr. Phil to reveal disturbing details of the night he killed his mother with a sledgehammer and to discuss what drove him to do it.

episodes.name: “I Hear Voices in My Head, but I'm Not Mentally Ill! Why Won't My Family Believe Me”
episodes.overview: Nick says he was drugged and a microchip implanted in his body, causing him to hear disturbing voices in his head telling him negative things and threatening his loved ones.

episodes.name: Hundreds of Photos in a Box: Snapshots by an Admirer Who She Calls Her Stalker
episodes.overview: Alexandra says an older friend carries around a box filled with hundreds of pictures of her, calls her up to 100 times a day and once got physical because she dated another man.

episodes.name: Won’t Work, Won’t Go to School: “My Son Just Wants to Game All Day”
episodes.overview: Sarah says her 23-year-old son is so obsessed with playing video games that he dropped out of college, is unable to hold a job and has lost more than 50 pounds; the young man says he would rather live in a virtual world than the real world.

episodes.name: “I Married My Sister's Boyfriend, And It's Time She Moves On”
episodes.overview: Amber had an affair with, then married, her sister's baby-daddy, and tensions run high as the sisters confront each other on Dr. Phil's stage; Megan's and Jenn's looks define who they are, but they are still not confident.

episodes.name: A Teen Admits to Killing His 11-Year-Old Brother: Who is Really to Blame?
episodes.overview: Shawna's ex-husband sues her for gross negligence due to the death of their 11-year-old son after she left him alone with her 16-year-old, who has confessed to killing him.

episodes.name: Stun Gun, Plastic Ties and Metal Handcuffs: “My Husband is Accused of Serial Rape”
episodes.overview: Kari tells how her husband reacted when she confronted him with evidence that he is a serial rapist. Other red flags she may have missed.

episodes.name: Dead Man Walking: Susan Sarandon Tries to Save a Man from Death Row
episodes.overview: Actress Susan Sarandon fights to get Richard Glossip, who is scheduled to be executed in a few days, off death row.

episodes.name: Is This Father's Extreme Parenting to Blame for His Daughters' Disorders?
episodes.overview: Sisters Rylie and Lenae say their father was physically and verbally abusive during their childhood, and it caused one of them to develop an eating disorder and the other to develop borderline personality disorder.

episodes.name: Lies, Lust and a Missing Million? My Ex Needs to Confess
episodes.overview: Leslie says her ex-husband is a lying, abusive sociopath and has hidden a large sum of money to leave her destitute.

episodes.name: Inside the Bill Cosby Sex Scandal: New Accusers with New Revelations
episodes.overview: Interviews with two of the many women who accuse comic Bill Cosby of drugging and sexual assault.

episodes.name: “My Wife Spends Thousands on Kratom Tea” ... “My Husband Tricked Me into Signing Our House over to Him!”
episodes.overview: Sherman says his wife spends $1,000 a month on kava and kratom teas, alcohol, Adderall, and vaping; she says he is controlling and verbally abusive, and he tricked her into signing their house over to him for $10.

episodes.name: A Baby Ripped from the Womb: One Mother’s Nightmare
episodes.overview: An attack in Colorado almost too brutal to believe: A fetus ripped from a mother's womb. Dr. Phil has the exclusive interview with brave survivor Michelle Wilkins, whose story made national headlines. A young mother-to-be, full of joy and happily preparing for her baby daughter's arrival, answered a seemingly innocent ad on Craigslist offering up free maternity clothes. She had no idea she was about to walk into her worst nightmare. Michelle went to pick up the clothing, but she didn't leave with new outfits; she left in an ambulance, clinging to life, without her baby. Her fetus was ripped from her womb. Michelle's inspiring story is one of incredible survival, love and loss.

episodes.name: Athlete to Escort: A Champion Runner's Fall from Grace
episodes.overview: From athlete to escort: Suzy Favor Hamilton is a former world-class runner who seemed to have a picture-perfect life. She was a champion. She appeared in a Nike commercial. She did promotional work for Disney. She was a loving wife and mother. But Suzy was living a secret double life. She was still Suzy, the fresh-faced, all-American girl. But she was also "Kelly" a $600-an-hour call girl who worked the Vegas strip. Suzy says escorting gave her an even bigger rush than running a race. What does she say made her do it? Plus Suzy says her husband allowed her to moonlight as a high-priced sex worker. He'll answer the question many in America are asking: Why would a husband be OK with this? This program contains sexual content.

episodes.name: TV Star's Alcoholism & Depression Spiral Out of Control: Can His Career Be Saved?
episodes.overview: TV Star Nicholas Brendon is best known for his role as “Xander Harris” on the hugely popular TV show Buffy the Vampire Slayer and most recently for his role as “Kevin Lynch” on the TV show Criminal Minds. But off-screen, he has been starring in his own private alcohol-fueled drama which has led to multiple arrests and been documented in celebrity magazines, social media and blogs. Nicholas, who was not exactly drama-free in preparation for his sit down with Dr. Phil, abruptly walks offstage during the interview. Is Nicholas ready to make hard choices and take the steps needed to save his life and career?

episodes.name: A Military Cop's Confession to His Family: “I Want to Be a Woman”
episodes.overview: Gary says he was floored when his nephew Zach, whom he’s been raising since he was a few days old and considers a son, revealed a desire to “become a woman” and identifies as transgender, using the name Steph. Gary says he cannot accept Steph and feels being transgender is wrong, and he blames himself for what he believes is a sickness. But there is another family member that also admits to being just as shocked by this revelation -- Zach’s wife Becky, who says she has sacrificed everything to try to make her marriage work since finding out about her husband’s desire to transition last year. Steph says she finally is able to be the individual she was born to be, and refuses to allow her wife or family to keep her from embracing her true self. How will Gary react to seeing Steph for the first time on Dr. Phil’s stage? It is an emotional moment you will not believe! Plus, don’t miss the shocking way Becky found out her husband was transgender.

episodes.name: MMA Fighter Sick of Battling Outside the Ring with Ex-Wife over Their Son
episodes.overview: MMA Fighter Eddie, 33, has spent the past eight years battling his ex-wife Melissa, 36, in court, over custody of their son. Melissa has lost custody twice, but she claims Eddie and his wife Ashley, 31, were only awarded custody because he’s a local celebrity. Eddie, Ashley, and Melissa can’t be at the same place together without causing an ugly scene in front of their son. This includes his little league games -- all caught on video. Can these parents agree to co-parent peacefully for the sake of their son’s well-being, or is it too late?

episodes.name: “My Daughter is a Beautiful, Intelligent, Talented, Egomaniacal, Drug-Addicted Liar and Thief”
episodes.overview: Constance says her adult daughter Candice is a lying, chaotic, mooching, immature terror, who steals and lives rent free in her house. Candice is proud to say she is young, hot and able to manipulate anyone into anything. Constance says her daughter opened credit cards in her name, forged checks and pawned jewelry for cash and drugs. Candice admits to using drugs on a regular basis but blames her mom for giving her cash or driving her to her dealer to buy them. Find out why security threatened to kick Candice out of the hotel before the show because of an incident with a male. Can Dr. Phil get this toxic relationship moving in the right direction? Will Candice accept Dr. Phil’s offer of help?

episodes.name: “Accused of Kidnapping Our Own Child”
episodes.overview: Waco and Alley claim Waco’s mother, Stacy, and her husband, Jacob, are trying to “steal” their 3-year-old daughter, but Stacy and Jacob claim the parents are neglectful toward the child. Waco, his mother and young daughter are registered members of the Muscogee (Creek) Nation, and a Tribal Court involved in the dispute granted Stacy and Jacob visitation rights. After the grandparents won visitation, Waco and Alley took their child out of state -- without telling their family -- and failed to show up for a court hearing, causing the child to be reported missing and the judge to grant custody of the child to the grandparents. Emotions run high when Waco and Alley learn from Dr. Phil for the first time that they’ve lost custody of their 3-year-old daughter. What is really at the heart of this family feud? Will Waco and Alley lose their child forever?

episodes.name: A Mother Missing: A Stepfather Accused
episodes.overview: Shelbie’s mother, Carie Zapletal, went missing nearly nine months ago, and she believes her stepfather, Ed, and possibly his daughter, Lauren, had something to do with her disappearance. But Ed claims Carie was a drunk who spiraled out of control, using drugs and attempting suicide in the weeks before her disappearance and left their home voluntarily. In addition, Ed says he was physically incapable of harming anyone the night of Carie’s disappearance because he suffered a debilitating stroke less than two months prior to her disappearance. Dr. Phil tries to get to the bottom of why a 48-year-old woman left her house in December without a coat, phone, wallet or car and hasn’t been heard from since!

episodes.name: Missing Mom: What Happened to Carie?
episodes.overview: In Part 2, Ed’s daughter, Lauren, reveals what she says happened the night her stepmother, Carie Zapletal, went missing. Does it crack the case wide open? Is her account plausible? Ed claims that there have been numerous sightings of Carie, and he is convinced she will return home soon. Carie’s daughter, Shelbie, says Ed’s leads are lies and wild goose chases. Carie’s good friend Courtney claims Ed and Carie had a history of arguments and describes the times she says she sheltered Carie after one of her and Ed’s blowout fights.

episodes.name: “Mom Kicked Me Out at 15:” Is Daughter Ungrateful or Is Mom Delusional?
episodes.overview: Beverly and her daughter, Courtney, 20, have been estranged for five years after what Beverly says was one fight about a messy home before her daughter walked out of her life. Courtney says she didn’t choose to leave but was kicked out after what she says was months of verbal and emotional abuse. Courtney says after she moved in with her father, Christopher, things went from bad to worse when Christopher filed for full custody of her. What followed was a bitter custody battle, an altercation between Beverly and Christopher and a shocking allegation of sexual abuse. Can this fractured family bridge the gap, or will this tense reunion be their last effort?

episodes.name: “My Mom is Worth Millions: Is Her Husband a Catch or a 'Catfish'?”
episodes.overview: Jordan says he is afraid his mom, Deanna's, husband could drain his family’s inheritance. Deanna married James in Nigeria six years ago after meeting him abroad. Deanna says there is absolutely no way her husband is only with her for money and adds that they met face to face!
